description:
Great grub!! From the kids' pancakes to the breakfast burrito. I don't typically leave reviews, but this place is worthy of 5 stars...we would've posted some pics but we couldn't stop eating.

Must try!!
author: Rusty P.

description:
The food was fine. The price was expensive. 
Ordered two eggs, bacon and hash browns, with a coffee. Standard breakfast. 
$17.00 should have been about $9.00.
On the plus side, they serve breakfast all day. 
For that they get an extra star.
author: Nick R.

description:
I took advantage of my friend visiting from Japan to try out restaurants I've had bookmarked for awhile.  One I've been wanting to dine in for a long time is Eat Americana.

The menu is standard Californian cuisine.  And they do it well.

I ordered the chilaquiles, that came with pulled pork and a sunny-side egg.  The pulled pork was delicious, and I loved it in the tomatillo salsa. 
 Chilaquiles is my favorite breakfast dish, and I'm particular about how it's made.  Eat Americana checked off everything I look for: crispiness of the chips, flavor, salsa type and egg.  The pulled pork gave it bonus points.  We also ordered the sweet potato tater tots, and they are addicting!  I'm amazed we didn't finish it, and I inhaled it later in the evening.

The space is a mom-and-pop diner with good service and great food.  I need to come back here soon to try more of their breakfast menu, which is served all day!
author: Vira P.

description:
I am so glad we discovered this place. We were fans of Ricky Bobby in the Haight and the kitchen at Broken Record before that. I found out that the cooks are now part of Eat Americana. 
We went with a couple of friends and had a stunning breakfast. I need to go back and get the half order of Bread Pudding French toast. My husband ordered it and I kept taking bites. It is served with cream and fruit and it is to die for. My friend ordered an avocado omelet and I think it had an entire avocado sliced on top of it. Coffee is great, mimosas too, they even have the Vietnamese coffee that comes with condensed milk. The pancakes are wonderful. Chicken apple sausage hits the spot. I am planning on going there again so I can experience more of their menu.
author: Molly B.

description: One of the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had. There is also a spicy short rib hash that's amazing. The bread pudding French toast is truly spectacular as well. The restaurant is very non-pretentious, but all of the food is so so so good. All of the staff are very kind.
author: Isabella S.

description: Fun place for breakfast or lunch - great service. The omelets were gigantic, the hash browns amazing and the breakfast burritos were delicious. My husbands bacon burger and fries were great. Loved the place and we will be back to try the Philly cheesesteak.
author: Ann P.

description:
OMG! The goat cheese risotto cakes are scrumptious! Fresh ingredients including cherry tomatoes, spinach, mushrooms, basil and asparagus! I wanted to eat all of it but decided to save one to take home for my adult son to try. I'm so happy this place is close! I'm secretly hoping my son is too full from the poor man steak frite that he won't have room and I can finish it later tonight!   

Can't wait to try their breakfast!

Update:  this is still my favorite place in the Richmond area. Went there last night and tried the Bread pudding French toast. It was yummy! Everything I've tried on the menu so far has exceeded my expectations. I have brought several of my friends and family members here and they rave about the food. The owner and the others that work here are very friendly.
author: Kim B.

description:
Yay! So happy my friend introduced me to one of his favorite spots. We came here for breakfast on a Saturday and it was not busy. We were seated in the corner (and out of sight) so service did take longer than it should have.

That said, the coffee refills (I have no clue how many coffees I actually had because my cup was constantly filled. I felt very happy throughout the day) and the food more than made up for it. I ate the Country Biscuit Plate and it was delicious. I tasted a bit of the buttermilk pancakes and those were awesome as well. 

My only regret is that I could not eat more. I'll be back :)
author: Ellen H.

description:
Cool little diner over by golden gate park with delicious food. I was really hungry so I ordered both the country biscuits and gravy and the king elvis pancakes.

Tho it only comes with one biscuit its a large halved biscuit topped with 2 sunny side up eggs and southern style sausage gravy. The biscuit was immaculate. Crisp on the outside and warm and soft inside and the eggs were runny and cooked perfectly. The gravy had a nice flavor but being from the south im used to it a little thicker and big chunks of sausage. Portion size was slightly light but not bad by any means.

The King pancakes were bomb. Im usually not a big pancake or elvis guy but you get 2 giant banana pancakes with the usual syrup and butter but sandwiched between them is hot gooey peanut butter and bacon. It was super filling, tasted amazing, and came with a few berries on the side.

Friendly family ran spot with the chef from ricky bobbys. Definitly check it out if you live in the area or are visiting golden gate park.
author: Sean G.

description:
The bead and butter pudding... that is all. 

Oh did I recommend the bread and butter pudding? Best one I've had in a very very long time. Great staff and quick service.
author: William M.

description:
Former Ricky Bobby fan and customer here! When I heard it was closing and the chef was revamping Americana Grill on Balboa, I was both sad and happy.

Finally made my way to Eat Americana and it was packed as it usually is on a Sunday afternoon. The wait wasn't Ionger than 20 minutes though.

I was glad to see the menu featured classic diner/comfort foods. I went with the cheesesteak and wasn't disappointed. It reminded me of a giant White Castle burger (guilty pleasure). The pork and cheese on waffle fries are a must order to share. I chuckled at the miniature American flag in a toothpick a top the mound of pork and cheese covered waffle fries. But what's more American than the fried chicken patty between two pieces of white bread? It needed the slaw. Nothing too special though. More like a katsu sandwich than a fried chicken sandwich. Still an overall good (heavy) lunch. 

Breakfast items were a popular choice all around me. Next up on my list, the bread pudding french toast.
author: Samantha L.

description:
My favorite eating partners and I hit up Eat Americana after Wanderlust 2018. We sure were hungry. The joint is cute, super tiny, and full of nostalgia. The staff weren't necessarily what I would call friendly, but they had service, so that's better than being friendly and never checking in!

It went down like this:
Pulled Pork Waffle Fries
Philly Cheesesteak
Short Rib Hash
Chilaquiles

And don't you dare forget about the half order of Banana Pudding French Toast. It was breakfast-dessert. That's a thing. We just made it a thing. Look, bread pudding has a special place in my heart. How could I not get this? Quit looking at me like that... Breakfast-dessert is totally a thing.

The Short Rib Hash and waffle fries were my favorites, but it was all super yummy. If I ever find myself in Balboa again, you can find me face first in that french toast.
author: Eagen P.

description: When we got our food we were so intrigued we didn't even stop to take pictures for yelp! The food is incredible. I had the bacon burger and my partner had the pulled pork. The buns were super soft and everything was so juicy and delicious. The pulled pork was a little tangy which was great and the coleslaw was great. The spicy mayo is to die for! Their pickles we also amazing. My partner said he's highly impressed and that we will be back for breakfast tomorrow! Also their fries were nicely seasoned!
author: Angelea R.

description: A hidden gem in our (Richmond) district of $F! For brunch, lunch or dinner one of the hands down, thumbs up, best (BURGER) American "modern diner" food in San Francisco!
author: Joe G.

description:
I've been spending time with family out here in the Outer Richmond, and encouraging them to get outside their comfort zone. You know--you sorta go to the same places and you get into a dining rut. So you gotta fire up the app and see what's out there. 

Now, I like me a funky fusion spot, or a deep dive, or a cuisine you can't find on every corner. My family? Not so much. So after some appsurfing, I settled on Eat Americana. It satisfied both of these concerns: a new place we hadn't tried, but definitely in everyone's wheelhouse. Traditional American food.

We rolled up after taking a car (this, too, was a boundary-stretching experience for them--their first time ordering one on their own) but that's not really relevant. I enter it into the record for posterity.

We rolled up late--probably around 8:30pm. There were only a few people there on a Saturday night, but it was warm and welcoming. The menu is indeed full of American traditionals, though some are regional. Wings. Philly cheesesteak, chicken parm. We orderered the latter two. Although the cheesesteak is served just a sandwich on a plate, we ordered a side salad which isn't much more than greens. You could also add fries, but you know, health. The chicken parm was dished a little more eloquently, and that's one of the things I like here--they seem to take a little more care in plating. 

My chicken parm was good. Not tough, served with just the right amount of sauce, and there wasn't a gross amount of cheese. All in all, it was well put together and I liked it. But that cheesesteak was the clear winner. I only had a bite, but it was a great, soft roll, stuffed with the steak/onions/peppers, and the cheese permeated the entire thing. It was something I'd go back to order so I could have one all to myself. Prices are pretty reasonable, and service was quick. They don't seat too many people there--it's a smaller spot with average decor, so I dunno if there's ever a big waitlist or if they get swamped if they have a crowd.

It didn't change our lives in and of itself, but the app led us to an outside-of-their-routine spot that turned out to be a real winner. The measurement will not be if I go back, as I'm out of this town most of the time, but whether family grabs a car and goes back.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
I had written a review for this place as Americana Grill, but I guess it's now a new listing as Eat Americana, so here goes my review. (I did take and post pix, but since it was so long ago, they didn't attach to this review.)

Last year, a group of us were carpooling to Sonoma to get our wine on. Since I was the last in the pickup line, we decided to grab breakfast / brunch by my house. Our group of six didn't have a reservation anywhere, so we ended up at Eat Americana on Saturday, November 19th around 12:15pm. It was a rainy afternoon, so it wasn't too busy. They sat us right away at a table in the back.

*2 Farm Eggs Breakfast: fried or scrambled, served with hash browns ($9), add Americana's Sausage (+$2), Avocado (+$2)
*B.A.T. Scramble: 2 egg scramble of bacon, avocado, tomato, cheese & scallion, with house hash browns ($12)
*Breakfast Burrito: 2 scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese, hash browns, sausage, peppers & onions, salsa, sour cream ($12)
*Buttermilk Pancakes: 2 pancakes with butter and maple syrup, 2 fried or scrambled eggs ($10)
*Country Biscuit Plate: sausage gravy and 2 sunny-side eggs over toasted buttermilk biscuit ($10)
*Americana Omelet: 3 eggs, cheddar cheese, bell pepper, onion, tomato, with house hash browns ($12), add Sausage (+$2)
*Breakfast Pork Sausage Patty ($4) x2
*Mimosa: prosecco, orange juice ($7) x4
*Fresh Ground Coffee ($2)
*Barq's Root Beer ($2) x2

If memory serves, I believe I got the americana omelette. I thought it was okay. Pretty standard and nothing special. I did enjoy starting the day with a mimosa and coffee though. I think they do bottomless, but I'm not sure if we got that as it was only $7 each. I tried the sausage patty which was good. Our server was very sweet. I drink a lot of liquids, so I constantly had to ask him for more water and coffee. I know that can be annoying since how much coffee and water can one person drink?! (The answer for me is A LOT.) But he never seemed irritated. Prices were good and everything was super affordable. I think we spent less than $25 each including tax and tip. They also give you small rice krispy treats with your bill.

I used to love Americana Grill as they had a huge menu and my beloved Joe's Special. It was a HUGE portion and so good! Eat Americana left me wanting more as the omelet didn't quite leave that same impression. In the end, decent and cheap eats.
author: Elena N.

description:
To start off all the pictures looked so amazing that I HAD to eat here for brunch. We started with the pulled pork fries. The fries were crispy. They gave a generous amount of pulled pork. My sister and I shared the plate. It was so good. The buffalo sauce, cheese and pulled pork are such an amazing combo on those fries. Forget the carne asada fries at your favorite Mexican taco joint, these pulled pork fries are waaay better!

The beauty of the bread pudding French toast is what drew me to this little restaurant. It reminded me of my grandmas bread pudding. It was so comforting. 

I highly recommend thid place especially the bread pudding French toast.
author: Estrella S.

description: No credit cards anymore!?! Cash only now. What a poor business decision. Food is delicious, just remember to bring cash otherwise you can use that "convenient" ATM and pay enough fees to have covered an appetizer. So sad, we came every weekend, we won't be back now.
author: CK Y.

description:
So good every time I come in. Very pleasant environment all staff is great with great service every time not just some times every time. Love the food. 


Photo #1 
Is the king obviously pancakes with peanut butter and banana with bacon. One of my favorites 

Photo #2 

Breakfast burrito one of my buddies favorites 

Love this place hope you love it too.
author: Tylor H.

description: If you like biscuits and gravy and you haven't tried theirs (served all day) then you are missing out. So freaking good.
author: Mallory T.

description: I went for dinner. The environment was clean and the staff was friendly. Sadly however my salmon was a bit dry. My daughter had pancakes which she enjoyed very much. Truly it's a diner so I probably ordered wrong. Id try breakfast or a burger next time
author: Heather S.

description:
Sad to give this place 3 stars.  We came on a Saturday around 11am, got right in without a wait.

My man ordered the mac and cheese with short ribs and I had the French toast bread pudding and a side of chicken apple sausage.

Both items were tasty enough, but just barely warm when they arrived 15 mins later. I know, I know, I should have sent it back - but I always think that they are just either going to nuke it (not my preference) OR heat it, but put their finger to spit it it (which I'm sure they would never do - I never did it when I was a waitress at Baltimore's Inner Harbor, and boy oh boy... some customers really made me want to)

So sorry my experience and review are not better, but maybe yours will be.
author: Amy W.

description: A MUST TRY place! The best lasagna I've ever had at a diner! The poor man's steak is such a good deal with delicious creamy sauce. The owner and waitress were so friendly. I visit every time I'm in San Francisco! They have lots of beer and wine too. It's an open kitchen everything is clean and delicious. Can't wait to try more on the menu
author: Lori D.

description:
I have visited a few more times and tried the risotto cakes, poor man's steak frites, and other dishes. I've liked them all. A lot of the food is pretty stick to your ribs type comfort food and portion sizes are good while maintaining the quality of the ingredients. I appreciate knowing which items are gluten-free, since that makes it easy for my significant other to choose suitable items (I don't have any dietary restrictions, but not knowing which items are gf can make it difficult for us to choose unknown restaurants). 

Keep making great food! The risotto cakes on my most recent visit were particularly good.
author: Crystal L.

description: One of my favorite places to go for American food when I'm in town. Growing up, I wasn't surrounded by American food, but this place, is one of the best places to go. Prices are affordable and food is cooked fresh. Always made delicious. I would recommend this place to visit with friends and you can definitely eat alone. Nice mom and pop shop that fits you for comfort and amazing food!
author: Shaeli Z.

description: My husband and I used to come to this place when they served Vietnamese food. It was pretty good till recently we didnt realized they changed the menu but same owner. They sell breakfast all day and a few dinner items. We came here during the day for lunch and the wait was not too long. The area gets busy so parking is semi hard to find sometimes depending on the time and day.  My husband ordered the biscuit over gravy and I ordered the B A T scramble. I want to say the food did take quite a while to come out. Waiting for quite some time.  The biscuit over gravy was pretty good, only that I wished the gravy was a bit more hot, not just warm. The B A T scramble was alright, it was just eggs with added items, nothing really special. The hash browns that came with the meal were pretty good.  All in all , I wasn't super WOW'ed about the food, but its a great local place for breakfast if your in the area. I dont think its worth it to make at trip out here. I prefer the old menu versus the menu now. I want to say customer service was great tho, but I wasn't not too impressed with the food.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I just finished lunch...still sitting at a table...and I can't wait to come back to try more of the menu!!!

The staff is so awesome - friendly, accommodating, cool and chill. The food is delicious! It took us awhile to figure out what we wanted to order (all of page one please!) - but I decided to order the burger time bacon patty (YES! Great suggestion from the cool guy that took our order), bread pudding French toast to share (OMG! So good!), and shared some pulled pork waffle fries (YUM!). Friends got the short rib lasagna, country biscuit plate, breakfast burrito, and the short rib hash...all of them so bomb!! Can't wait to come back and try more tasty food!!!
author: Nicole B.

description:
Been in the neighborhood since the 90s and remember when this place was Americans Grill. New chef, new menu, and new decor has lead to a lot of success for Eat Americana. 

I have had the chicken parmigiana, burger, steak fries, and breakfast burrito and I would order them all again.
author: Gordon J.

description:
Love this place! Everything on the menu is excellent, beef bacon burger to salads. You can't go wrong. Chef James is super talented and creative with all his food creations. 
#bestfoodever!
author: Lulu R.

description:
Nice spot, not too touristy and walking distance from where we stayed. 
James is the man and makes some kickin baby back ribs!
We really enjoyed them along with the pan cooked salmon, chicken parm, some wings, a strawberry goat cheese salad, and the Poor Man's Steak Frites. 
Perfect portions great-tasting sides and mouth-watering flavors. Excellent service as well. 
Definitely worth the review and a revisit.
author: Mike G.

description:
I've been coming here since high school (GWHS alumni 2007 WASHHOUSE!) Lol anyways I was actually on my way to Little Henry's but they were closed and Americana has always been a favorite of mine.

They changed the place, new floors, artworks, signage. I like the change because they're staying current. They also changed their menu, but kept some of the original stuff. Honestly they always had a TON of stuff to choose from, so now it's just a little less.

I will say they got more expensive, which is expected. I love that the owner or that one waiter guy who served me back when I was in high school is still here :)

Had a good lunch!
author: Jewel S.

description:
We are Eat Americana lifers! 

Seriously, this place is the bomb. It's got the spirit and warmth of a diner with the pizzazz and flavor of new American "cuisine".  Essentially it's a "gourmet diner" without all the fan fare. For this New Yorker, it doesn't get any better than this!

The chef - James - is so creative and also a really good person. His servers Heidi and Jordan are also good people. We love this. 

This summer we were enjoying the crab Louis salad and the cheese burger, today we had the pickled jalapeño crab omelet, the sweet potato tater tots, and the warm spinach salad... which had beets - my favorite - and bacon - everyone's favorite!  

It was all so tasty and delicious and the portions are large.  In fact we got full and didn't finish the omelet or even get to the short rib lasagna.  We had it boxed up and are looking forward to dinner!

Oh and the mimosas were strong and delicious, just the way we like them!  On the way out James was telling us about the goat cheese salad with fresh persimmons (the persimmons were sitting on the counter) and the s'mores dessert. Needless to say we can not wait to go back for dinner and dessert!

Earlier I noticed James making banana pancakes which he later told me is called "The King" and which he explained also has peanut butter and bacon, just the way Elvis liked them. You can bet I will have that the next time I brunch there!  We got there after the brunch rush so there was no wait but apparently the restaurant is packed when the door's open at 10 am. 

Brunch ends at 3 and dinner begins at 5. James was cool to let us stay late amidst all the prepping he had to do for dinner service.

The food here is so creatively good with such a warm and friendly staff that we feel extremely lucky to be locals to this spot on Balboa. Oh yeah and there is outdoor seating that we opt for on sunny days.
author: Monica E.

description:
We stopped for lunch here after visiting the Legion of Honor, as it is only a mile from the museum. The menu is most definitely "American" - lots of comfort food here. It's a small place but there was easy parking ( we got here before noon). I had the pulled pork on a brioche bun and fries. The pork was rather bland, to be honest, and there was way more bun than meat. The fries were hot, thin and delicious. The Americana omelet was large and satisfying. 

I guess you have to be really in the mood for heavy comfort food and I wasn't. As a result, I found most of the choices to be too heavy or greasy. My lunch date, however, loved his choice.  Service was prompt and efficient but not particularly friendly.
author: Karne N.

description: Down in SF for a soccer tournament. Had 90 minutes between games and brought the hubby and two kids here for lunch. Exceptional food and service. Hubby ordered green chili Mac n cheese, little one ordered the pancakes and eggs (pancakes were eaten by her older sister, with much protest). I ordered a goat cheese omelet (yum) and older daughter ordered a breakfast burrito. All food was delicious and the Food Network was on so we watched a show about food while we enjoyed our meal! Winning!
author: Denise D.

description: Great bang for your buck. They were very flexible with subbing out food items as requested. Very generous portions, I took home a to-go box. The side of fries is a big basket easily shared with 2-3 people. Cash only as of 9/1/18.
author: Sarah C.

description: Amazing food, had the pork steak, absolutely delicious.  Wife had the poor man frites, equally enamored. Everyone at my table enjoyed their meal
author: Jon C.

description:
17.12.22.        Revisited newly rebooted dining
                       Visited 5 times since the reboot

Food ---------------------- 4 to 4.5
Service ------------------- 3.5

The new cook, James Moisey, have done a great job on the new dishes.
Very good flavor, exectution, reasonable portion
Previously I tried a Shrimp Diavolo Pasta dish
    A nice creamy dish yet slightly spicy dish
    Filled with fresh cooked seafood
    It was cooked to perfectly every ingredients

Short Rib Lasagna
    Nice rich thick beefy flavorful dish
    Braised short ribs were tender of cource ... short ribs after all
    Portabella mushroom and Parmesan add additional unami
    It also packed with some pesto, tomato sauce to push in more unami
    Ricotta added for creaminess
    Good goto dish

Chicken Parm
    A pretty good chicken parmesan nuff said ...

Shrimp Pasta
    Pack full flavor kinda of reminds me of Shrimp Diavolo, 
           their earlier dish a year ago

Lamb and Porchini Ragu
    Rich thick flavor bomb dish
    Pappardelle egg pasta w chopped lamb shoulder
    Porcini-sherry cream sauce
    Heavenly

Very well conceived comfort food ... one of my FAV
The only reason I didn't visit it more often ...
    not near my work or home
    so many new restaurants to try

But, it is on my REPEAT list ... meaning it is worth to revisit
author: S.K. Y.

description:
This is definitely NOT a kids friendly restaurant.

We went for a late lunch (after 1:30pm) over the weekend. We have two young kids so in general we try not to make inconveniences to anyone when eating out. There was a wait for our table and I already had my husband and the kids waiting outside of the restaurant for about 15mins. When I was told that the table would be ready in couple mins by a waitress I brought in my older kid waiting in line in the restaurant since we did not want to lose our spot. There is no waiting area as this restaurant is pretty small and the open kitchen is located on the right handed side of the entrance door. Once my child and I entered the restaurant in 20 seconds one of the chefs behind the counter shouted at us saying that we should have had waited outside of the restaurant (and we did) and also he did not tell other patrons waiting in the restaurant doing the same thing. I was shocked by his behavior. NEVER come back!
author: Wendy C.

description:
Tonight's visit was probably our 8th time here. That makes 8 great meals, and even for any of the most lauded high end restaurants in town that's great consistency. Chef James so clearly knows good food, and in this small 2 person open kitchen his magic goes into everything. The menu has lots of classic dishes that are all homeruns, but usually I'm more in the mood for some of the dishes that he gives a fun spin. Everything tastes great, seems fresh, and is prepared in an elegant way, especially for being comfort food. Honestly the thing that makes me the happiest is that this is simply the way these dishes are supposed to be done, yet nobody seems to care enough to do them this well. That's what makes Eat Americana worth traveling to. But good food alone sometimes isn't enough for all 5 stars. Every time I've been the chef gives a warm greeting and a fond farewell and the owner is all smiles. 

THE FOOD

Tonight I had the asparagus and mushroom grilled cheese with pesto and such melty Swiss cheese that each bite was like when a magician pulls neverending handkerchiefs from his sleeves. It just kept coming. My wife had fresh papardalle pasta with asparagus, peas and a cream sauce with a touch of fresh mint. It seemed super creative. Previously I've had the breakfast burrito, one of the best in town, the chicken parmigiana, which I have to fight not to get every time, the lasagna, the tomato soup, pancakes, and the biscuits and sausage gravy, amongst some others. And the menu is always changing!

THE SERVICE

Top notch. The kind of place you can have a conversation with the chef while he works, and where the waiter can't stop smiling. Tonight I noticed the chef wearing a shirt from a lesser known Philly cheesesteak place my dad took me to, known to locals to be the best in the city. Chef James says his is the best in SF. Next time. 

THE LOCATION

Being way out in the avenues and being pretty much diner food (although not completely) this place is too easy to miss. Don't miss it.

SUMMARY

Comfort food shouldn't make you uncomfortable like most do in this genre. Eat Americana is fresh, flavorful, and a pretty rare gem.
author: David L.

description: Came in for breakfast kind of late , my food was excellent the chickito , my wife had the B.A.T ... my son had the French toast bread pudding. Over all great presentation and looks very appetizing . My wife's hash browns were oily, not to the point of inedible but definitely noticeable. The wait staff was polite , but rushed to sort checks. Over all not a bad experience but not amazing.  A little pricy for 3 people for breakfast.
author: Alex B.

description:
Ate here for the first time today with hubby.  The food is excellent, atmosphere casual and laid back.

I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup and hubby had the philly cheese steak.  Both were absolutely delicious.  Probably the best grilled cheese sandwich I've had, and my sandwich/soup was only $10.  For the quality of the food, prices were very reasonable.

We shared the banana split sundae for dessert (with Nutella sauce!)- also excellent.  The vanilla ice cream they use is yummy!!

We love eating at unpretentious restaurants with quality, tasty food.  We'll definitely be back here.
author: Abby D.

description:
I live in this area for the last four years. I always walked by this little restaurant but I never felt like going in. Today I felt like having a burger, and I knew this place had burgers. So we went in. 
I have to say, I am very pleased by the food and the friendly service. Loved it!
author: Coté M.

description:
My cholesterol hates this place...

The philly cheesesteak here is absolutely phenomenal!!! I always consider ordering other items off the menu but I just can't get away from the cheesesteak. It's just too damn good! Perfectly toasted bread, lots of melted cheese, and, most importantly, ribeye shaved to the ideal thinness with incredible flavor, texture, and juiciness. Also, the fries are bombski!!!

I can't wait to be back. I'm very thankful to have a true taste of Philly so close to my spot in SF.
author: Justin H.

description:
3.5 stars. I'm really sad. I love coming here for their mac and cheese (plus yummy stuff like mushrooms, sausage, avocado) and even though it's pretty pricey, I still come back for it. What's unacceptable though, is now the portions are getting smaller!! I can't justify paying $16 for what's essentially half the portion (see pic). I'm still giving 4 stars though because the staff is very friendly and it pains me that now I can't order this anymore :( 

Edit: minus one star because they got my order wrong. They forgot to give me mushrooms in my mac n cheese but still charged me for it. *Anguished cry*
author: Alice C.

description: Green Chili Mac-n-cheese with bacon and the Pulled Pork Waffle Fries are SUPER good!  Friendly service, intimate setting.
author: Cody C.

description:
Great neighborhood restaurant. I had been to this restaurant years ago and have been anxious to try their new menu and cuisine since hiring the new Executive Chef. There were 3 of us and we shared the parpadelle lamb ragu, the green chile mac & cheese, Brussels sprouts, and 2 liters of wine. The food was excellent as was the service.

We will definitely return!
author: Chilly W.

description:
If there is a hogwarts of cooking, it's where James Moisey learned to cook. 

They've updated their menu - corned beef sandwich (can i just call it a reuben? i'm calling it a reuben..) is the best i've ever had. EVER. i'm talking better than Tommy's Joynt, Weiss Bros, and your irish mother's. sorry... was that too far? 10/10. 

Mom got the pork steak. let me put this into perspective: i hate pork. the only kind of pork i eat is cured and bacon. but this pork could go head to head with some of the best beef steaks i've had and hold its own. 10/10. 

My grandmother is ukrainian. She hates all restaurant food - i'm talking, i took her to House of Prime Rib and she DIDNT LIKE THE STEAK. but u know what she LOVED? James'  shrimp fra daviolo. shock and awe.. shock and awe. 10234902394/10 

The service, as usual, is spectacular. 


OH and a note to the breakfast lovers: its served all day. the burritos are the size of my forearm.
author: Alana V.

description:
Been here a couple of times, overall satisfied both times. Interested in trying some other things on their menu.

- Breakfast burrito: absolutely delicious
- Pulled pork waffle fries: OH YES! So sooo good
- Wedge salad: OK, not really worth it (originally had ordered the other salad on the menu but was told they couldn't make it tonight)
author: Anne G.

description: This place is surprisingly pretty good. It use to be a fusion Chinese American restaurant but now it's like an American Italian restaurant . I think one of the chef is the same chef as before. Well anyway overall I enjoyed it. The short rib lasagna and mac and cheese with short rib is pretty good. Lots of soft short ribs. Service is good too. Next time I would like to try their breakfast.
author: Christy V.

description:
Rumor has it a well known chef has found a new residency here. 

Let's just say I had to keep myself under control or else I would of left with a huge food baby. 

Definitely try the following items

Steak fried rice
Jalapeño crab cakes
Pulled pork waffle fries
Americana Louie salad with shrimp. 

Looking forward to trying the rest of the menu. 

I'll definitely Keep this place in my rotation
author: Lyman C.

description:
Only eat in. This place has great food but I'm giving it three stars for customer service. I placed an order for pickup on Eat24 and received a confirmation email. When I arrived 40 minutes later, the manager said they turned off their Yelp app and do not accept online orders on busy days. As much as I understand that, it shouldn't have the option for online orders then. When I asked if I could order my food now and wait, he said I'd have to be charged again since he didn't get the first order. Decided to go somewhere else and get a refund since he wasn't very helpful. 

Like I said, the food is good so I'll come back but be wary of online ordering. It was a hassle that could easily have been avoided. Either call and order or eat in.
author: Megan M.

description:
Love that Americana is in the neighborhood!

Everything I've tried has been spot on but I always have a craving for the Philly Cheesesteak. 

Also extremely notable (other) items include the Short Rib Lasagne, Pork Steak and mashed potatoes, Shrimp w Polenta and the Breakfast Burrito.

The short rib is killer so if possible try to add it to everything!!!! 

Thanks Tony, Lem, James and David!

Ps. They have trivia on Wednesday nights, see you there!
author: Lauren B.

description:
americana americana this is more than a lunchhh
americana americana this is more than a lunchhhhh

i see you with the hipster clothing every day
yo man must think it's safe for you to outfit that way
and idgaf violate y'all's friendzoneship
so i eat back in the 4top slay the dish leave a tip

still he can't stop me from having entrees
tonguein you down with -ugh- shortrib hashay
pulled pork on yo sando in the moonlight
sippin ya body with iced tea chick all night

i hurried here immed after 3rd meal to catch 4th meal in their literally final kitchen minutes. walked in all tables were group selfieing. lol #goodtimes

(^_^) Pulled Pork Sandwich $10 (http://bit.ly/2p8OnvL)
w dem onions n pickles doe

(^_^) Iced Black Tea $3 (http://bit.ly/2nTgfnp)
mandatory at all meals

(-_-) Short Rib Hash $15 (http://bit.ly/2ogYeLH)
not terrible not memorable

::shrug:: guess i'd return sometime to try more, wear more red white & blue next time, set off more bottle rockets n roman candles n shhh jk
author: Dan B.

description: Delicious flavors! Beautiful presentation! Service is good, not overly friendly but the servers are there to do their job. My only complaint is the portions are kind of small for the prices. Otherwise a great experience and I plan to come back anytime I'm in the area.
author: Connie S.

description:
Get the pulled pork waffle fries. 

Just do it.  We ordered ours with no scallions and the cheese on the side. 

I loved how generous they were with the pulled pork portions, the tang of the buffalo sauce, and how the fries were crisped to perfection.

Our waiter (who I believe is the owner) was unbelievably attentive and he even checked back in with us to confirm how we wanted the fries. 

Other notable dishes here are the Short Rib Lasagna and the Green Chile Mac and Cheese

Eat Americana has been serving up wholesome Vietnamese & Italian food since its opening in 1996. They just recently brought on chef James Moisey, formerly of RickyBobby and Broken Record and are continuing to serve up drool worthy comfort food in a lovely warm setting.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: The food is so good here!!!! Had the short rib hash and the short ribs melted in your mouth. The hash browns light and crunchy with sauteed onion and just a hint of sweetness. I can't believe I cleared my plate clean! And then ordered the perfection of a pecan pie served warm with a huge dollop of vanilla ice cream. Wonderful service and a great meal. Can't wait to go back and try other dishes. Highly recommend this restaurant.
author: PJ C.

description:
Great neighborhood spot for dinner and brunch. Nice staff, tasty food. 

Server forgot to bring out beverage during the meal, so took it off the bill and gave it to me in a to go cup. 

Will definitely come back as there are so many things in the menu we want to try!
author: Ian B.

description:
A little pricey but worth it fresh ingredients and great service! I love that you can see the kitchen and chef performing their duties! 

I had an egg white BAT fresh pick and the crown jewel a homemade biscuit ! Damn that biscuit! It was the best I've had in a long time crispy flaky and the homemade blackberry am .... damn best since
 moms! 

I will return this was my second visit when I'm in the outer this is my place!
author: Paul D.

description: The asparagus and mushroom melt is a tasty vegetarian treat! The goat cheese risotto cakes were just ok. They were rather bland and could use something to make the flavors pop. We'll definitely be back to try the mac and cheese or when we're craving breakfast for dinner.
author: Jenn F.

description:
Food: 4.5/5
Cleanliness: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Atmosphere: 4/5 (We went during closing so it was kind of dead but the people who were there seemed cool)

My friends and I were around the area and randomly chose this place based on reviews and they did not disappoint. Service was very nice and attentive and the waiter was pretty funny cracking jokes. But the food was bomb. It had a nostalgic feel and come to find out the head chef came from what once the famous broken record. 

I had tried the pork waffle fries, short rib hash, short rib lasagna and bread pudding french toast. All really good. The short rib hash was a little dry especially around the edges but it made up with flavor. I only had a bite of the lasagna but it was delicious. 

All in all great find and definitely coming back to explore the rest of the menu.
author: Alvin D.

description:
Giving this place one star only because as we waited in line for a seat on a Saturday morning for breakfast, I was blatantly ignored by the male host as I asked for a better idea on timing. This is why we decided to skip this place altogether. Why give business to a place with such bad service?

May decide to give this place another chance in the future but it is a shame this place has displayed such horrible service upon my first interaction with the host. Pity because I live only a few blocks away. 

Perhaps others will experience better service. Good luck!
author: Rose E.

description: Eat Americana has got to be the best American Fare food restaurant that I've ever been to, Chef James Moisey puts out food like I've never tasted before and frankly that's why I have been following him from restaurant to restaurant! I would recommend one thing on the menu, but I can't, it is all good delicious food that's made with the best ingredients and recipes that will blow your mind!!! So if you find yourself in San Francisco please make this one of your foodie / comfort food places to visit.
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description:
Small place but I really liked it. Very homey feel! Only had one dish which was the biscuits and gravy topped with two eggs and all I can say is it did not disappoint! Gravy was soo good and the biscuits where nice and flaky eggs cooked to perfection.

Ill be back!
author: Michael W.

description: I came in expecting an average dinner. I left fully satiated and excited to bring my family and friends here. I ordered the Green Chili MAC & Cheese which turned out to be a great vegetarian option (but you can also add bacon). The staff is friendly and I had no problems waiting to be seated. I'm ready to come back!
author: Timothy N.

description: First time dining in the restaurant after multiple PostMates deliveries. Took our boys here post movie at The Balboa.  Really cozy spot (15-20 tables?) Breakfast served all day!!  Hooray!!  One child had grilled cheese w/tomato soup -- divine!  The other had pancakes and scrambled eggs. Hubs had chicken wings followed by short rib lasagna -- the best!!  I had the spicy chicken sandwich with my mimosa and it was just perfect!!  Support this local business -- they're friendly, delicious, clean and make great food!!
author: Kate J.

description:
Dear Americana,
Thank you for the 10lbs you've helped add to my frame(not)... But darn it I just can't stop coming around! I've never had a bad meal here and the service is wonderful!
Xoxo:)
author: steph b.

description:
Came her 3 times in the last two months for lunch to see what I like on their menu and most of it is pretty good

I ordered the eggplant lasagna just ok 
Waffle fries are a must for me
Buffalo wings are hit or miss depending who s cooking that day
Bread pudding was great
Short rib hash with no bell peppers tasted good with the sunny side egg
Rib eye geeen chili Mac and cheese was good and al dente just needed to tell them not to salt the ribeye it was too salty for me
Texas toast was good
Hash brown and eggs were done correctly
Philly cheese steak was good also.


I'll prob try their grilled cheese sandwich 
And breakfast burrito next time .

I was Sad to see there old menu gone but things don't last forever :)
author: DOM d.

description:
A group of us were hunting for a brunch place on our way to wine country on a rainy winter Saturday and we literally stumbled upon this place after deciding we didn't want to wait an hour across the street at another place that was serving brunch.

When we were sat, the restaurant was nearly empty, so my restaurant radar began to go off but I was able to calm myself down and I asked myself, "how bad could this place be?" Most of us(minus the driver of course) kicked off our 1st meal of the day with a mimosa. I could see the owner making these straight away in the back station. He promptly brought them over and they were quite tasty. Not too much OJ and not too little champagne. After ordering, the food began to be delivered in quick succession. I went with the Breakfast Burrito in what I had hoped would stave off some of the effects from the hearty wine tasting that was coming up. My choice was rich and filled with a nice balance of meat and vegetables. It wasn't too oily and the tortilla had the right amount of chewy texture without being too wet(or dry) from the ingredients.

Service was always johnny on the spot, and the owner who took care of us throughout the meal, was gracious and friendly. What started as an apprehensive dining event for me turned into a pleasant and relaxing surprise. Eat Americana is an absolutely solid brunch spot. I just hope the wait doesn't become an hour in the near future like so many other brunch spots.
author: Dennis W.

description:
We live in the neighborhood and Eat Americana is one of our go-to dinner spots.  James is a great chef but is completely down-to-earth (a rare combination), and Tony and all of his staff are always very cheerful and attentive.  The food is delicious, creative without being pretentious, and reasonably priced; even the beer and wine are fairly priced.  

On our most recent visit we were excited to try some of the new menu items, and were not disappointed.  The salmon was perfectly cooked and very tasty, while the griddled asparagus and onion appetizer was the perfect blend of savory, smoky from the griddle, and just spicy enough to add interest without overwhelming the other flavors.  

We highly recommend Eat Americana!
author: Jim H.

description:
Went here for dinner to celebrate my mom's birthday. Everyone enjoyed all the dishes and Tony did a great job taking care of us!

We'd been to Broken Record and Ricky Bobby's, when Chef James was there. Broken Record was always delicious, Ricky Bobby's was hit or miss. Eat Americana is like old time Broken Record days, every bite of everything we ordered was delicious and we can't wait to go back!

We ordered....
Brussel Sprouts
Burger
Chicken sandwich 
Pork Fries 
Mac and Cheese with bacon
Philly Cheesesteak 

And Tony gave my mom the banana bread pudding French toast dessert.... yum! When the table was ready to order, someone said, "start with the birthday girl," from that.... Tony, on his own brought out the dessert. It made my mom very happy... the rest of the table too, since she was so full, we all were able to help her eat it!

The only thing that could use improvement would be the timing of the food. Some dishes came out one at a time... but no one left hungry or dissatisfied. Everyone enjoyed their meal, even ones that came out later than the rest.
author: Gavin K.

description: Loved everything on the menu so far. Favorite dinner item is pulled pork sandwich (amazing pickles and pickled onions on the side), favorite breakfast items are breakfast burrito and BAT scramble. French toast is delicious but very heavy - definitely a group dessert. Perfect local neighborhood spot.
author: Michael W.

description:
Went on a Saturday around lunch time and it was a very short wait for a spot for 2. Really loved the biscuit with honey butter and blackberry jam and the rest of our food was good but the overall service experience wasn't great.

Our order was brought out in pieces: first the biscuit (a side), then the sausage patty (a side), then my partner's meal, and eventually mine. These things should've been brought out all at once. It was especially frustrating because the person sitting next to us (who ordered after us) got his meal after my partner and before mine. He actually finished eating before I even got my food.

Turns out there was a mixup in the kitchen for my meal just not being made, and the manager asked if we needed anything (what do you say to that? We we're hungry and didn't want to wait for them to re-make two meals). We were eventually comped for my main meal that went missing.

The waitress said usually they bring things out as they're ready, which I wasn't a fan of even if my meal hadn't been forgotten because I'd prefer to eat a course all at once (e.g., I ordered the sausage to eat with my eggs, not on its own).

We sat outdoors, which was nice though a little on the chilly side and the convenience store next door has a bell that wouldn't. stop. ringing.

Wheelchair accessibility notes: There's outdoor seating, some of which is on a slight incline but doable. Indoor seating is pretty close together since it's a small space so might be tough. Street parking only (there are some handicap spots on the area). Didn't use the bathroom.
author: Tricia R.

description:
A large group of us all needed to fill up our tummies before heading to our favorite winery up north. We originally wanted to dine at a brunch spot literally across the street from here but the wait was ridiculous. One of us suggested we walk across the street to Eat Americana since it looked clean and there was no wait.

We were quickly sat and once we ordered the food began to come out quickly. Some of us went ahead and did some pre-drinking but as the DD, I just had orange juice(minus the champagne). I went with the Pancakes and side of eggs and overall it wasn't bad. The pancakes were fluffy enough and not dry. Eggs were done the way I specified. So, all in all, a decent breakfast and without the usual long brunch wait.

The owner(I believe) took care of us mostly and he was kind and customer friendly. Truly not a bad spot to grab brunch.
author: Angela L.

description: Delicious! Loved everything we ate. Service was sweet. I'm recommending this place to everyone I know.
author: Lolly B.

description: The burgers here is fuegooo. It's a little pricey for a burger and fries, maybe 17 bucks total but you do get a whole basket of fries. Anyways the burger is super juicy and tastes amazing, I haven't tried any of the other items but they seem tasty as well. I believe there are better places to eat in the city but this is not a bad spot due to convenience.
author: Bryan D.

description:
I've never seen this place busy, and I don't understand why! It's got great food and great service. Everything on the menu is comfort food, and it's GOOD. Tony, the owner, is always welcoming and super sweet to all customers. My coworker took me here on my birthday, and they ended up giving me bread pudding on the house which I really appreciated. 

My favorite thing to get here is the crab cake. I'm a crab lover, and this dish didn't disappoint. The outside is fried to crisp perfection, and the inside is soft and delicious and so full of flavor. I've been here a couple times and I've never had a bad experience so I'll definitely continue to come here.
author: Cindy F.

description: This place is bomb! Take it from a local. Not just because the chef from broken record works here now... lol but is so good you won't be disappointed. I can't believe it's taken me so long to review this place. I appreciate it so much more after going to that Over priced hipster spot across the street that place is garbage, don't waist your money. The mac and cheese with steak is my number one.
author: Sasha M.

description:
There's something about grilled cheese and tomato soup that gets me every single time. It's one of my absolute favorite meals. I seek it out. 

It's a reminder of childhood as a good omen of contentment and nourishment. 

The grilled cheese is truly spectacular here. American cheese layered with fresh mozzarella! Some cheddar for pure goodness. 

The chef actually asked me what kind of cheese I wanted! They had 4 kinds. On Texas toast, no less.

The coffee was strong and dark. Tasty with some half and half. 

Service was great, too. Both chefs were working and super wonderful to me. You can tell they have a healthy rapport. How did I only just find you?

I'm excited to try the whole menu. I'm eyeing those risotto cakes next. 

Basically, I've found my go to.
author: Priya S.

description: Great food and fast service! B.A.T scramble was delicious with great hash browns. The green Chile Mac and cheese was delightfully flavorful. Bread pudding French toast was delicious!! Great post-Land End's brunch.
author: Ahana S.

description: Tried to eat here last Sunday and was pretty much refused service.  Staff did not feel like working at 9pm with a 10pm close time.  Will never go back, but was interested in trying this neighborhood joint.  Just wanted a piece of pie while waiting for my movie at nearby Balboa Theatre (they advertise this spot on their previews).  They lost a possible good customer in the hood. VERY DISAPPOINTED!
author: Giovanna B.

description: Great breakfast spot that has an elevated diner vibe. Everything we ordered was delish. Didn't have to wait in line like you do for your typical SF brunch restaurant + left super satisfied. Chilaquiles and banana nut muffin were fire!
author: Joanna D.

description: I was here for dinner and had a beer, a wilted spinach salad, and the pork steak with hash browns and cole slaw. It seemed more like breakfast cooking than dinner cooking. Everything was okay, but with tip, it was $46.00 for a quick meal. Maybe I ordered wrong, or maybe it's better at breakfast. Everyone was very nice, and the food was fresh, but at nearly fifty bucks, I was seriously underwhelmed.
author: Paul C.

description: This place is great.  The portions are all much bigger than they look, so buyer beware. Do not order too much.  The breakfast burrito I had was huge; I could only finish half. Their homemade biscuits are delicious, and are served with delicious fresh berries.  The produce is all very fresh and delicious.  When I asked for extra salsa, the server brought me a nice portion and told me that she had made it herself earlier that day, and it tasted as good as when my dad used to grow tomatoes at home and then make homemade salsa. This was such a pleasant find.  We can't wait to go back and try all of the desserts.
author: Niki M.

description: This is by far the best breakfast/brunch spot I have been to in the Richmond! Very friendly, great portions and overall excellent food!
author: Tyler Z.

description:
This place is a hidden gem.
Found it by accident and we are more than happy that we did. Whem my boyfriend and I have the chance to go, we go. 
The food is really good and tasty but the pulled pork with cheesy waffle fries and buffalo sauce its... Something ( I'm addicted to it, that's how good it is) and the stuff oh well... They are amazing, they treat you like family.
author: Anna K.

description: Out of this world breakfast burrito. Best I've ever had. And the mushroom omelette also gets 5stars. Wow really.
author: Valerie T.

description: The menu is very creative and made it difficult to choose what to order.  I'm a vegetarian and am not used to having so many options.  Tony  and his chef were super friendly.  Comfy, cozy casual atmosphere.  A great place to stop in after a visit to the beach or local museums.  I'll definately be back.
author: Cynthia G.

description: I love the pulled pork sandwiches from the south, I lived there half my life. But the pulled pork sandwich I ate at Eat Americana was the best I have had. The fries were excellent as well. I didn't eat it all because I have a hard time eating sometimes. I hope to be back tomorrow!
author: Brian B.

description: It's a great place. Burgers are wonderful! A little surprised at the prices, but it is delicious and cozy.
author: Marissa M.

description:
Food quality was great! Ordered the shrimp pasta in the lobster cream sauce. Mom had the mushroom omelette and brother had the pulled pork sandwich. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful!

Service wasn't bad. Our waitress was cordial. The only staff member on the floor that maintained a smile on his face was the Asian gentleman. The other two associates looked like someone forced them to come in and only one forced herself to smile when in front of tables but yeah... the other guy definitely wasn't trying. Like, if I wanted to eat around depressed ass people I would bring my food to an oncology ward.

This easily could've been 5 stars, but overall it was more of a 3.5 experience and I'm not gonna knock the entire restaurant because a couple people might've had an off day. But if this was their "A" game, I would consider hiring other servers that don't show how disgruntled they are on the floor.
author: Orlando D.

description: Sooo GOOD!!  I had roasted brussel sprouts and spinach salad and OMG the flavors were delicious - very stoked!
author: Sue U.

description: Former Rickybobby chef works here so the food I had higher expectations.  Passed!  I was here during the past President's Day, and while place didn't look too crowded, food took awhile to arrive on the table. I had their B.A.T. (Bacon Avo T) Scramble plus the included thin, crispy hashbrowns (one of my fave breakfast food) side was nicely flavorful.  Portions just hit the spot.  The next time I'm here, I'm going for the hashbrowns & something else on the tasty menu
author: Jessica S.

description:
Why the fifth star? I want this place to live, that's why. Tender, succulent short rib meat  served in so many creative and scrumptious ways.  The sweet potato tater tots actually taste like sweet potatoes. The sunny side up eggs that are done to perfection and add magic to all the yolk touches. A s'more sundae that is worth having dessert at lunch for even though it means hitting your head on your desk as you nod off in a food coma later.
They need help with personnel I.e. 4 people are running a busy made-from-scratch restaurant.  It is going to take a minute to get your order.  You may have to wait a minute for the check. The folks who run it are nice but they are very busy. The restaurant biz is tough and you can't work strangers as hard as you work family so that is where we are. Profit margins for restaurants are looooww so it's all about a couple of people working like The dickens from sunup to sundown.
I will be back for at least 5 items on the menu.
Easy parking, delicious food nobody else is doing, check out their story on their website and then GO!
author: Miss F.

description: Found this place while on vacation. Pleasantly pleased with the food and service!! My group was happy to find this place and plan to come back tomorrow.
author: Michael R.

description:
I live in the neigborhood and I have been here before the rebrand for a cheese steak sandwich but this time it cost $17.

Out of this world prices for mediocre sandwich.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
3.5 stars is more accurate. 

Food = good. Only complaint is the burger that's never cooked the way we want it.

Broccoli au Gratin = awesome. $7.00

Burger Time! (Beef patty, they have one with bacon too) = ordered well done but still very pink in the middle. $10.00

Side salad with Thousand Island dressing = $3.00 Extra add-on to burger.

Service = friendly. They called to let me know that the food was ready for pick up, too! 

Prices = moderate. Dinner for one came out to $21.85, with leftovers.
author: Fannie S.

description: Great food,friendly staff,there brunch is excellent along with all there offerings highly recommend Eat Americana our go to neighborhood spot
author: John C.

description: An excellent breakfast spot in a cute, somewhat unexplored area is SF, at least for most non-residents.  The breakfast burrito looked amazing (that's what my husband had). The pancakes were the perfect thickness and cooked to perfection (I ate some of my nieces) and the mushroom omelet I ordered was delectable.  I added avocado which topped the eggs perfectly!  If we're ever back in the neighborhood a again (we stopped to do laundry), we'll definitely return!
author: Brandy Q.

description: First time coming back since the remodel and menu change...definitely a solid 4.5 I had the bread pudding French toast and my friend had the breakfast burrito,good food simple and tasty..I will definitely be back
author: jonathan h.

description: We went to lunch on a Sunday, the place was perhaps 2/3 full. Service was poor, not enough people working and those who were did not pay attention. Took us perhaps 15 minutes to order with maybe 6 tables filled. But the food was great, really good. The portions were fairly large, there were four of us and we all commented on how good it was. Very much worth a visit, at a reasonable price. Just don't be in a hurry.
author: Tim M.

description:
Great for brunch if you're looking to indulge on the calories but not the cash. My friend and I ordered the portobello mushroom sandwich and grilled cheese with heirloom tomato. Both were so delicious! The portobello with mozzarella on brioche bun was quite moist and well-made, and the grilled cheese was rich and savory, served on crunchy, warm Texas Toast. 

Besides the fact that they overcharged us, the mistake was caught, and we left very satisfied.
author: Julia Y.

description: I've been there for brunch, dinner and even ordered delivery for lunch! Highly recommended. My goal is to go there before for after seeing a film at the balboa theater.
author: Heather M.

description:
Americana has been completely remodeled.  Been a loyal customer for over 10 years.  This was my go to spot for breakfast style diner food.  All those old dishes are now a thing of the past.  While it wasn't the best I was always satisfied.

Turns out they the chef from Rickybobby is now here.  
This place will lose a lot of the regulars as it's now aimed towards the hipster crowd.  The new food is really good.  I understand why the owners went in this direction however the old Americana will be missed.
author: Terrence L.

description:
This place knows how to present dishes. The pulled pork waffle fries that we ordered had an American flag on it. You cannot get much more patriotic than that. The waffle fries were crispy but I wish there was a little more pork on it. The chicken parm was also delicious, but I wish there was a side of fries/potatoes/veggies included in it for $16. Finally the pork flat iron steak had tender meat and dehydrated broccoli just the way I like it. No change is needed to that dish.

Customer service was nice, so I wish them the best moving forward.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I haven't written a review on Yelp in quite awhile but I felt it necessary to do so for Eat Americana. This has been my go to spot since 1999 for cheesesteaks and burgers. I also used to frequent Rickybobby back when they were still around for their burgers. Once I heard Americana hired the old Rickybobby chef I was ecstatic due to moving back to the neighborhood.

Now the food is diverse and great! I have eaten here and ordered delivery from Postmates. Here are my regular choices that are all really good:
-Burger time beef and bacon patty
-Country biscuit plate
-Short rib lasagna
-Philly cheesesteak sandwich

Being able to grab breakfast all day is a treat! Also their Thai iced tea is still around which is great.

I do miss getting pho with curly fries but having good regular American food in a Asian dominate neighborhood is a breath of fresh air. Thank you Eat Americana!
author: Benny S.

description: I had the breakfast burrito, it was probably the best I've ever had. All of the food is made fresh and it's worth the wait.
author: Christina F.

description: This place is great!! Came in for breakfast today and everything was super tasty! The bread pudding French toast is the best bread pudding I've ever had, and the beef short rib hash thing was really good. Staff was super chill and nice,  I will definitely come back soon.
author: amy m.

description: Eat American is fantastic. We came for All Day Breakfast for Dinner and weren't disappointed. I got the B.A.T. Scramble and my wife opted for the Beef+Bacon Burger. We also ordered the most generous carafe of house wine imaginable. Service was excellent and the food was delicious. We'll be returning for sure.
author: Ben S.

description: Friendly staff doing their job and great food. My only problem is wanting to try something besides the spot-on Country Biscuit plate. (ps the side of biscuits with honey butter and jam eases this pain).
author: Chad C.

description:
Top notch.

This place has been revamped from its days of 'Americana Grill' featuring a new menu, a better chef: James Moisey (of Ricky Bobby & Broken Record) doing what he does best, Americana Cuisine. 

Fair prices, warm atmosphere, open kitchen. Eat Americana offers all day breakfast, an intimate inviting setting and pro tip: Corkage is $10 

Get in here and get some food in that belly!
author: Aine H.

description: Creative with extreme flavors we've always found Dinner served at 5 PM to be a valued jewel in cool and quiet outer Richmond.  Attentive to detail service and wine by the half carafe - value and quality make this a must try.
author: Kevin Y.

description: Came here with some friends. The staff is friendly and attentive. Their breakfast is delicious, and the coffee is bottomless.
author: Rachelle M.

description: A really fun diner in a cute neighborhood.   Great breakfast spot.  The portions are unusually large so you do get a lot for your money.
author: Stevie A.

description:
Four of us visited Eat Americana for the first time over Easter weekend after leaving the museum, and we were HUNGRY.  We'd seen the Yelp reviews and I already knew I wanted the pulled pork waffle fries and, while everyone else was torn between other items, I knew they'd want to share.  Our clever server knew, too, and brought small plates for us to divvy up so we could taste each other's dishes.  It was the perfect dining experience for us as we are all "foodies" and were able to sample not only the waffle fries but also the short rib hash, crab cake, and mac and cheese with sliced rib-eye.  To appease our carb-and-fat-guilt we also ordered the grilled asparagus -- heavenly.  Everything was satisfying, with top honors going to the crab cake, asparagus and of course the waffle fries.

The owner is a friendly and pleasant soul, visiting the table to check on things, and I think it was his elderly (94!) mother who passed our table several times, beaming and wishing us a Happy New Year (it was Easter Sunday).  She was so charming that we all wished her a Happy New Year, too, many times over.  On our very first visit, they really made us feel like part of the family.

Good, hearty food, attentive and friendly staff, and a charming family running the place.  Oh, and top it off with being able to watch the Warriors win to take the first game of the playoffs!  Thumbs up!
author: Sue C.

description: This is definitely my favorite restaurant in the Bay Area! The staff is always friendly and the food is unlike anything else on this street. You literally cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. My favorites are the pulled pork waffle fries, jalapeño crab cake, short rib hash, fried chicken sandwich, the tomato soup, and of course the bread pudding (you HAVE to try the bread budding)!
author: Annalycia J.

description: Came here after reading yelp reviews. I ordered the chilaquiles thinking they might be disappointing like they tend to be in most restaurants..... boy was i wrong, they were delicious!!! My bf got the steak hash which he loved. The good gets two thumbs up. Service was ok, waitress could be a bit friendlier. We would come back though for the food.
author: Vanessa R.

description: Really good food and really friendly staff, will be back.  A little pricy, but that's just the way in SF I think... blame the cost of living.
author: Nate S.

description:
The food is fine - pretty tasty, but nothing we had (chicken wings, crab cakes, risotto, philly cheese steak) was out-of-the-park spectacular. But still happy to have this spot in the hood.

Ambiance and staff were friendly. We didn't know it was trivia night, but it was! So we stayed and ate and played (see: lost). Fun times.

Things this place could potentially work on:
1) *Soundproofing*: They need acoustic panels or something - it's super loud. My husband and I could barely hear each other.
2) *Speed*: We waited 45 minutes to an hour for our food, and 20 min for our check. Luckily we were playing trivia, but still! It took super long for some very straightforward dishes. 
3) *Menu*: There's a lot going on. I wonder if they could just pare it down to their best dishes and make each of them a bit more unique? 

tl;dr - Nothing special but a solid spot to have in the outer richmond.
author: Nami S.

description: First time at Eat Americana. Simple menu, solid options, would definitely go back. Only con is beer is a little overpriced.
author: Jack T.

description:
3.75 

When my friend and I heard that the chef from Broken Record/Ricky Bobby found a home in the outer richmond, we knew we had to pay a visit.  I heard a lot of great things about Broken Record and have dined at Ricky Bobby so I could only imagine the food would be just as good here at Eat Americana.  My initial thought was, why Americana?  I've dined here a few times and there was nothing really special; very basic American dishes prepared by Asians, so why would a well known chef want to work here?  Shrugs.  

We were seated right in front of the window next to another couple.  Our area was blocked off by the kitchen so it was very difficult for customers to wave down a server.  Service is everything and when a customer is not tended to, you take away one star but in this case, the couple next to us walked out.  We waited for a while until my friend had to pop up like a gopher out of a hole to wave someone down.  

Pulled Pork Waffle Fries - perfectly cooked waffle fries with the right amount of crisp, tender pork, not too saucy

Shrimp Fra Diavolo - Basically shrimp and grits.  Grits can be heavy and the portions are usually small but when the dish arrived, I was looking at a big bowl of soup with floating shrimps.  The texture of the grits was under cooked and it was just wayyy too much.  We saw another customer order the same dish and felt so bad that she had to eat the whole thing on her own... this can easily feed 3 people

My friend had to pop up again to ask for the check at which none of the servers noticed.  Since the kitchen was right behind us, we had to ask the Chef for the check!  With the new Chef in town, this place has potential BUT service needs to step up their game.
author: Linda N.

description: Truly a neighborhood favorite for a casual American dining experience. Chef James Mousey formerly from Rickybobby and Broken Record has reinvented the restaurant that has been in the neighborhood for decades previously serving Italian and Vientamese cuisine. James puts his magical twist into every dish from the simple sweet potato tatertots to lamb and porcini ragu with pappardelle pasta. It's a great neighborhood hangout place with a very casual welcoming atmosphere.
author: Alex K.

description: Do not get the good reviews of this place. Flavorless, reheated food. Very over priced for sad breakfast. No ambiance. Would never go back!
author: Emma M.

description: Had breakfast there this morning. We had the B.A.T. Omelette, it was delicious! They were generous on the bacon, avocado and tomatoes..., I also had a pancake side and that was delicious as well... I can taste the baking soda in pancakes and this one had 0 bad aftertaste... my friend tried the bread pudding and and the reviews don't lie, the bread pudding is amaze balls! We arrived at 11:30 on a Sunday morning and we were sat right away... the place is busy but they are quick, efficient and good!  Great place to eat at if you are in the golden gate park area!!
author: Darcy E.

description: We haven't had a bad meal here yet. Their cheesesteak is phenomenal, and the green chili mac and cheese (add steak) is great as well. We also love their asparagus appetizer. And the pulled pork waffle cheese fries are the ultimate hangover cure. Sometimes the food comes out a bit piecemeal, but it's all fantastic once it finally gets there.
author: David K.

description:
What happened to this place? It used to be Americana Grill and was a nice little Balboa eatery that was run by a very nice Vietnamese guy. I had not been for a while and i am at the Balboa theater and see an ad for Eat Americana. Looked like a hipster diner now. 
 A few weeks later myself and a few friends decided to try it out.  Judging by the reviews and all the stars I think since we came so late they let their guard down and we got to see how everything is frozen and not fresh since they kept pulling out bags of frozen food in plain sight.  We all agreed on Burgers that looked amazing. While waiting for our Burgers ( mind you, we went in at 9 and there was no one else in the place.) It took 20 mins to get 3 burgers made. Not that big of a deal. When we were waiting my Roommate noticed above the fryer was a small pan with a few pre-cooked burger patties. We all looked and the " chef " some white dude with a beard slaps cheese on the patties and tosses them in a toaster oven to melt the cheese. We all gave him the side eye. When the burgers came out the fries were way overdone ( due to him talking and not paying attention to the fries ) and super salty to where my lips were puckered. The burger was greasy, fries were light brown and it was about $13.00 a burger. We also noticed when they were making togo orders all the Shrimp and Chicken came out of generic restaurant supply brand frozen bags. I take it nothing is fresh here. It tasted it too. This place is trying to be an upscale Hipster destination. FAIL ! if Gordon Ramsey was here he would have laid into him.  I would not bother going here judging by the quality and their use of 90% frozen food. There are plenty of better places here.
author: Jerry A.

description: Good Philly Cheese Steak. Soft bun on the outside with melty and juicy meat and cheese in the inside. I did not give 5 stars due to price tag.  Price is above average for the sandwich.
author: Joseph C.

description: If you enjoy your food drenched in velveta cheese then you've come to the right place. Service slow waitstaff not attentive. Ordered multiple different dishes, most had way too much cheese sauce!
author: Tanya K.

description:
Such a huge improvement of what it use to be. Now there's is a new chef, which of course means new menu and cuisine. It's so delish! The short rib lasagna is bomb! My husband brought home leftovers one time and I think it was a lamb Shepard's pie. That was probably the best Shepard's pie I've ever had. And I'm half English! Lol loved the shrimp pasta with lobster cream sauce. Just an all around great place for dinner with the fam! And I grew up on that block, so it's also a great excuse to go and be nostalgic!

I would give it five stars, but the service is kind of off. Very nice servers, and also very helpful.... but just on the odd side. Lol Which I can deal with because the food is great, and they are genuinely nice.
author: Monica R.

description:
Quick review based on one visit and would love to come back and try more of the menu. I also will for sure be back to try the brunch! 

Ate: pulled pork waffle fries, shrimp Louie, green chili mac and cheese, shrimp diavalo, short rib lasagna. 

Positives: Very large portions, everything was really tasty especially the short rib lasagna, super friendly staff, nice remodeled clean environment 

Not as positive: Food was rich (gonna have to do a few extra sit ups tomorrow!)

FYI: The new chef here previously helmed the uber popular Ricky Bobby. He has brought similar menu items and the same crowd pleasing style to the new space.
author: Michelle L.

description:
The pulled pork sandwich was more gourmet than you would expect in a little place like this. The roasted beet and goat cheese salad was delicious. The manicotti was very good and so was the Philly cheesesteak sandwich. The hamburgers were very good also. We are a party of six, so yes we ate a lot! The staff was friendly and recommended sites for us to see while in town. We highly recommend this place for lunch if you're in the Goldengate Park area!
One problem: I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, then changed my mind and ordered the beet and goat cheese salad. He brought me both and admitted that he didn't delete my first order. I was still charged for the pulled pork sandwich, even though I shouldn't have since it's not what I ordered. I must admit that the pulled pork sandwich was delicious though.
author: April S.

description:
This is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

In my nearly-10 years of living in the Outer Richmond, I only visited Americana Grill twice. Both times I found the food to be bland (club sandwich with fries, and pho), but cheap. I wondered how they stayed open with such a big space, a huge menu, and virtually no customers.

I heard about the owner focusing the menu and bringing on a new chef so I thought I'd give it a try. Not gonna lie, I was also lured in by the promise of pulled pork waffle fries.

First impressions: Lovely decor. Very clean. Nice that it's open late, so that I can grab a bite to eat after a movie at Balboa Theater. I was greeted by the chef, the owner, and a server upon walking in.

Food: The grilled cheese & tomato soup hit the spot on a rainy night, and for only $10. My friends were not complaining about their Chicken Parm, Poor Man's Steak Frites, and Country Biscuit Plate. In fact, they were all saying how the price point was just right for the quality and quantity of food. 

And oh, snap, the bread pudding french toast! Probably the best bread pudding (or french toast) I've ever had. 

I came back again another day, in the middle of the afternoon. I wanted more of that grilled cheese and tomato soup. Yes, it was that good.

I returned one more time, yesterday. Ordered the B.A.T scramble, which was so flavorful that I didn't reach for my usual hot saucet; the broccoli au gratin (it may be drowning in dairy, but it's still veggies, right?), and the buttermilk biscuit with honey butter. All very VERY good.

I wish the new location and its people the best of luck and a welcome to the neighborhood! (I still haven't had the pulled pork waffle fries...guess I gotta visit again!)
author: Dwigt S.

description: We had the burger, cheese steak, sweet potato tots and pork fries. It was all super good!
author: Stephanie V.

description:
Oh hey!!!! They remodeled!!! The same cozy/comfortable feeling with a modern twist. Menu is completely revamped and they have a new head chef that's heading up the kitchen....suppose to be somebody famous, but I didn't want to be that guy that didn't recognize a celeb so I didn't dig too deep....Go check him out, let me know if I missed an autograph opportunity. =) or maybe =(

Even a bigger fan now!
author: Jerry W.

description: Found this restaurant... in a neighborhood that is definitely not on the tourist path...great little diner.... and it is little, with a waiting line...just good regular food, no bling...a little loud, overall we enjoyed our meal.  Because it is s small neighborhood restaurant... Only issue is parking!  We had to park 3 blocks away... it was with it, now we are going to walk it off going back to our car.  And off to the tourist areas.
author: Marilyn C.

description:
I love this neighborhood spot! 
Super cute little place with delicious food , amazing breakfast food and super satisfying burgers and sandwiches . So happy to have this gem right near my place !
author: Evan P.

description:
My husband and I tried this place for lunch today and were really pleasantly surprised.  The service was very friendly and the food was terrific.  I had the goat cheese risotto cakes.  They come on a bed of beautifully cooked veggies (mushrooms, squash, tomatoes, spinach...).  My husband had an excellent omelette, with hash browns that were crunchy and golden on the outside and soft on the inside (woo hoo).  Oh yeah - they serve breakfast all day and the bread pudding french toast with fruit sounded really decadent so we'll be going back soon.

Years ago we tried this place and really thought the food was lousy.  I read recently they got a new chef last year and I'm just sorry we didn't come back sooner.  What a nice experience.
