I didn't give it 5 stars because there's really no ambience - it's really plain. Some art/redecoration would go a long way to giving this diner-y place that extra star as a neighborhood fave.
author: Cassie C.

description: My family loves Eat Americana! They have something that each one of my picky family loves.....even for my vegetarian daughter! They're great for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Friendly and fast service, too!
author: Yvette T.

description: A group of us stopped in here for breakfast before we headed out on our drive. Food and service was ok. I had the eggs with avocado, sausage, and cheese with potatoes. It was filling...just what I needed. I paired my food with a mimosa!  What a great start of a day even though it was raining!
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description: Excellent food and the best service we have had in SFO. Good, honest cooking.  It is fabulous and very family friendly.
author: Ireland F.

description: Pork sausage patty so sweet it can't be beat, Country biscuit plate, man this place is so great!
author: Gerald P.

description:
Americana Grill turned Eat Americana! And I'm a fan! I've always love what the chefs at Broken Record and Rickybobby do and now Americana has James Moisley at the helm! Now mix that in with the nostalgic Americana Grill and you have an inviting and delicious location! I have to say that Balboa is starting to look classy, without too much of the crazy hipster vibe.

Gone are the Vietnamese pho and rice plates and it took me some time to get used to the fact that I won't be seeing 100 different dining options. But quality over quantity, right? The whole menu has been revised and revamped! So what did we get? Pulled Pork Waffle Fries for starts, duh? My wife had the Philly Cheese Steak and I, after studying the menu, went for the one dish that I'm a sucker for: Shrimp and Grits (or Polenta in this case), but this was listed as Shrimp Diavolo. 

Pulled Pork Waffle Fries: Quoting my wife, "Waffle fries are the best; you can't go wrong with it." And it worked so well with the pulled pork. They also drizzle a cheese and buffalo sauce on it and makes for a good combination in every bite! Try it at least once!

Philly Cheese Steak: Okay, Philadelphia will always have the claim to the best in the nation, but I think this is pretty darn close. I thought it wasn't a big sandwich, but it was packed with flavorful sliced beef, the right amount of cheese and roasted red peppers, and all that between a soft roll. The dish was served with a side of pickled jalapenos. 

Shrimp Diavolo: Again, I had the shrimp and grits at Broken Record and Rickybobby and both had been the best I ever had. Except, it wasn't easy to get to those locations. Now that I can order this at the one place I used to go weekly, I might have to get back to some old habits! On the menu, the dish is served with polenta in lobster broth, six pieces of plump shrimp and fried basil. If you like grits, you'll like this! If you don't, just try it. My wife isn't a fan of grits/polenta (thinks it's old people food), but she stole a few bites of my bowl before getting back to her cheese steak.

Now portions are decent despite looking small than expected. Either way, you'll be fed with some of the best chow on Balboa. This is a neighborhood joint with the right upgrades and it'll be a classic if they stay as it is! To Eat Americana, I'll be back to try everything else! Cheers!
author: Jeremy L.

description: I've been here before and it has good food, but the service today was just appalling. It was busy for brunch but there were clearly many tables free, they just were too busy to seat people. After we were seated we were ignored for another 20 minutes before someone took our order. 15 minutes later, our server came back and asked what our orders were again. Our food didn't arrive for another 40 minutes. The server very nicely offered to get us a drink on him, but we were already running late for our next appointment by then and the damage had been done. It seemed like it was just a badly managed day combined with a busy Outside Lands weekend. Probably won't be back.
author: Victoria M.

description: Delicious diner style dishes, with California flair! Never had a bad dish here, and with outdoor seating, it's a win on Balboa! Come hungry! Leave happy! Excellent service and food!
author: Martie A.

description: Excellent brunch fare. Reasonable prices. Great neighborhood place. Ate everything-- sauce and all with the biscuit, bacon and eggs. Delicious! Will be back again!
author: Tina C.

description: this place is amazing.   Come with an empty stomach.   great food, friendly staff and the presentation of the food is awesome
author: Chuck L.

description:
My husband loves coming here and has been coming for years and years. I never liked this place, but since the menu is so big with American and Vietnamese options, I knew I could find something to eat. 

Also the saying...you don't realize how much you miss something till it's gone....well...I do miss their pasta, the huge portions that comes with soup or salad and garlic bread. It's all gone. The Vietnamese side is gone too and rented out to a Ramen joint. 

The remodel is nice. I was curious to try this place since the new chef came, but they redid the whole menu completely. 

Got the sweet potato tots off the breakfast menu. It wasn't bad. Nothing special.

Got their philly cheese steak. If you want to add salad or fries you have to pay extra. I think it should have at least came with fries! The cheese steak was good, but bread was too soggy for me. 

Hubby ordered the beef fried rice and it never came. They forgot our order. There was only 3 tables, so it's not busy. How can they forget? 

The owner felt super bad, but since I had my son with me we had to leave because he didn't want to sit still anymore. He did give us the tater tots on the house. He knows my hubby has been coming here for a long time......so I have no idea when we will return. 

Service needs to be a bit faster and they are probably working out some kinks still since they just reopened.
author: Karen H.

description: This place is so good. Never even heard of this restaurant. We were coming from the beach in San Francisco. Service was quick and the staff was very good.  I ordered the jalapeno crabcake, which was very good.  The biscuits were quite good too. I was disappointed that I was too full for desert. We will be back.
author: Marc M.

description:
Just finished an absolutely amazing meal here at Eat Americana. My family and I have been dying to try this place since it changed over and I'm so glad we did. I ordered the simple breakfast with two eggs over medium and hash browns. I added avocado and it was delicious! My boyfriend ordered buttermilk pancakes and a side of bacon and eggs which were all cooked perfectly. And my mom ordered the bread pudding French toast which was incredible. We also ordered a buttermilk biscuit which was SO GOOD I honestly have never had a biscuit that good in my life.

I can't wait to come back and try different stuff. This is definitely going to be one of our favorite neighborhood spots! 

Thanks James, your food is delicious and we can taste the love!
author: Morgan B.

description:
I only write one star reviews for bad experiences. Check all the posts that I have submitted.  Eat Americana is so awesome I felt compelled to write a positive review. 
I was a big fan of Cafe Americana. There basic breakfast of eggs and bacon was much more affordable than other places in area and just as good. They had amazing Loco Moco which was far superior to any of the Hawaiian restaurant chains. Their burgers were basic but better than fast food and way cheaper than other restaurant burgers. 
When the restaurant evolved to Eat Americana and changed the menu I was excited since I am a supporter of local businesses and I am happy to pay whatever to keep the Balboa Corridor happening and progressing to a true destination. 
Eat Americana has exceeded expectations. Came here with my kids since the wife is out of town. We loved it which many parents know is hard to come by. 
My son had pancakes which isn't that difficult to do but he has a high standard for pancakes and waffles (thanks Tyler Florence) and he rated them very high. 
My daughter who has a more sophisticated palate had the sweet potato tater tots and the creamy polenta. The tater tots were super tasty. Great crunch with perfect texture inside with just enough sweetness. The creamy polenta was a different story. They were prolific. The cheesy goodness was well balanced and the scallions and shaved parm only enhanced the experience. This $6 starter is worth the drive out west. I have had so many exceptional polenta and grit dishes but this version was beyond perfection. I can't wait to return  to have the Shrimp Diavolo which sits on a bed of their polenta, this is a complete upscale Shrimp and Grits. 
I had the Flat Iron Pork which was also amazing. They offer it Rare or Medium Rate which might freak some but hey the farmers are much smarter now so no need to cook this meat completely through. As an entree this is one of their more high end dishes. This entree did not disappoint. The pork and sauce is comparable to any Michelin rated restaurant but the Granny Smith Apple slaw is beyond comparison. The vinaigrette sauce and potatoes are very refined but the whole dish beats out any dish that cost more than double. 
Eat Americana is making great food and not charging enough. Get here before they figure that out.
author: Paul M.

description: Went here with a friend who was visiting from Malaysia because we were seeking quality American style food. This place was AMAZING. We had: biscuit/jelly, mac and cheese with bacon, pulled pork sandwich, ice cream, and root beer float. It was hands down the best mac and cheese I've ever had - great combination of tasty cheeses. And the pickled onions in the pulled pork sandwich were the best red onions I've ever had. I wish I lived closer so I could go back more often!
author: Teryn H.

description:
I pretty much stuff my face every time I eat here. Their beef and bacon burger patty is delicious. GO BURGER OR GO HOME.

They've also got some great soup and those pork fries are rich. And, they host trivia every Wednesday night that's a really good time. The host is super hot (for you, ladies).
author: Ali L.

description:
My boyfriend grew up going to Americana with his parents. He took me a couple times over the years and I guess it worked out for us because I always want to eat Vietnamese food and he always wanted American food.

We met up with his parents here last night not knowing about the re-opening. I looked at the menu and was immediately disappointed that there were no more Vietnamese options. I wasn't really in the mood for American or heavy, so I ordered the Louie salad.

While waiting for the food to come out, I checked in on Foursquare and saw a tip that the former chef of Ricky Bobby is now here! I instantly got excited about the food. 

The pulled pork waffle fries and sweet potato tater tots were really good. Even my salad of lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, cucumber, carrots, and boiled egg was really good! (Mainly because it was soaked in thousand island dressing, but I could still tell the quality of the produce was high).

I tried a bite of the steak fried rice and it was REALLY good. 

Even though I'm sad that I can no longer make fun of a restaurant serving both Vietnamese and American food, I'd definitely come back here!
author: T D.

description: Great food and really awesome neighborhood feel. Waffle fries with pulled pork was delicious, tons of pork. Short rib lasagna was full of meat and fresh basil, super tasty. Bacon grilled cheese with tomato soup also really good, lot of bacon and really good tomato flavor in the soup. Definitely will be revisiting regularly!
author: MacKenzie G.

description: EATING HERE IS A MUST DO! Eat Americana is fabulous!  It is the very first stop I make whenever I travel to San Francisco. I live in San Diego and crave their bread pudding french toast so much so that I race to get to the restaurant as soon as my plane lands, it is that yummy.   In fact, all of there food is delicious.  No matter who I bring to the restaurant with me, everyone enjoys their food and goes away from the table full and very satisfied.  The portions are huge, the quality of the ingredients is superb and they manage to get the food out quite quickly which is a feat amongst itself since this is a tiny restaurant.  Jim, the chef, is very friendly and as he cooks in the middle of the restaurant, he will answer questions if you have one.  His wife greets, serves and manages to provide great service in what I would think would be quite a stressful job since the restaurant is always crowded and there are often lines out front.  The whole restaurant feels very homey and welcoming.  As previously stated, this is a must stop for anyone that wants quality food that tastes amazing!
author: Monique M.

description: Chef James is back!  We have enjoyed his talents since Broken Record, Ricky Bobby & now Eat Americana.  We tried the Pulled Pork waffle fries, Portabello mushroom sandwich and new bread pudding french toast.  Every bite was yummy.  The prices were also very reasonable.  When we go back we will try the Philly cheesesteak and steak fried rice. Service was good and everyone was nice and friendly.
author: Ruben F.

description: Friendly and affordable but most of all, go for the comfort food. It's true chef James Moisey is cooking all your favorites from Rickybobby--pork fries, great eggplant lasagna, shrimp Louis, and an unbelievably creamy bread pudding French toast. Check out my blog review for more details. http://cookingwithamy.blogspot.com/2016/09/americana-grill-restaurant-review.html
author: Amy S.

description:
Out with the old, and in with the new. New interior (after remodeling) decor, new menu, and new chef.

The menu is more condensed. I like that because it has less options to choose from, meaning that whatever is offered on the menu is a helluva great dish. The new chef was the former Chef at the beloved Broken Record and Rickybobby. Yes, the mastermind who came up with the idea of pulled pork cheesy waffle fries (with the iconic American flag sticking out of the pile of yummy goodness). And yes, that is on the menu. (!!)

They have an open kitchen. You can see your food being made if you're sitting at one of the tables near it. That, to me, is pretty awesome. I love watching cooking shows so being able to watch the chef at work is a plus.

And oh. Did I mention that they serve breakfast all day? Their brioche French toast was some of the best I've ever had! It's served with fresh strawberries and a healthy serving of whipped cream. Oh yes, oh yes.

Gotta give this place a try! No lines out the door... Just yet. I wouldn't be surprised if it gets super busy by the start of next year because the food speaks for itself. The food is absolutely amazing. Glad to see you back in business, Chef.
author: Annie S.

description: We were visiting from out of town and stumbled across this gem. Fresh food and so very good. Definitely recommend the pulled pork waffle fries!
author: Travis K.

description: This place was amazing! I got the pulled pork sandwich and it was by far the best I've ever had. My companion got the fried rice and goobled it up instantly. Such great food!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Super stoked on the new menu and remodel. The biscuit was melt in your mouth and the pork fries are nothing short of badass. Go hungry and leave hella full without an empty wallet. T
A new go to for me!
author: Mango P.

description: I would recommend this to anyone. The food is fairly priced, and the quality is surprisingly very good! The service is nice as well. Would strongly recommend the biscuit plate.
author: Kyle H.

description: I really want this place to succeed. The food isn't bad but I don't think it's a good value. For the price I'd expect beer on tap and better atmosphere. As someone who lives in the neighborhood I think the space would be better off with a more casual dinning style. Something like Pluto's would be good. Salad for a healthier choice. Real kids options. Beer on tap and a small grill that could do meat for salads and burgers. Cut back the fried stuff.
author: Eric P.

description: Great accommodation despite of a small space. My party had 7 people, but we found a way to all fit the outdoor table. Great customer service and food. My only nuisance was when it got busy. Getting the waiters attention could be difficult at times. All in all, I enjoyed the food and accommodations. If you're visiting the Legion area there, give this place a try.
author: alan t.

description: Everything was amazing, from the coffee all the way to the main meal and the service!
author: Rachel R.

description: My boyfriend ate here before for breakfast  so for Labor Day he was so excited to take me for lunch since we live walking distance. I saw their advertisement at balboa theaters while watching movies. We put our name on the list after 20 minutes of waiting and other in line got seated a Caucasian couple just came in putting his name on the wait list and they got seated right away. We asked why they got seated before us they were not before us on the list. The staff says they had reservations. It was baloney excuse for preferential treatment because they are white and we are not. I am so disappointed I will not ever try  that restaurant and warn my neighbors. When we tried to complain to manager they just don't care. We end up eating at the cassava instead. The owners needs to know their employees has very bad customer service.
author: Cherry C.

description:
I enjoyed this spot so much that I felt compelled to write my very first Yelp review. 

On a cold and rainy Friday night, the wife and I just wanted something quick, easy, and comforting after a long work week.  After the usual back and forth ("what about ____?"... "nah."), we randomly found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try. The reviews were good and the menu looked promising, and who doesn't love a place that serves breakfast all day? 

We arrived around dinner time and the place was actually quite empty - maybe 3 other tables were taken. As another reviewer mentioned, that usually gets the spidey-senses tingling, but we were undeterred.  The vibe in the restaurant is very causal. Several flat screen TVs on the walls with an open kitchen right in the middle.  I tend to like restaurants with open kitchens because its usually fun to watch and more importantly you get some assurance that no funny business is going on with your food.  

We decided to share an order of the green chili mac & cheese and the country biscuit plate, plus a side order of the sausage patty.  Everything was great. Solid comfort food. Well-executed, no frills, and somewhat elevated classics.  The mac & cheese was creamy and crunchy (from the broiler) with just a slight hint of the green chili. And my favorite, the country biscuit plate, was highlighted by some of the best white sausage gravy I've had in recent memory. The biscuit, which I assume they make in-house, was also great.  The side sausage patty, which in retrospect was probably not necessary, was also very tasty and perfectly sautéed to create a crispy outer shell that was wonderfully addictive.

Probably the only downside, which was 100% our own fault, was that we went a little too cream-heavy with our selections and felt pretty bloated as we waddled out of the restaurant. We also would have appreciated a beer selection on draft, but definitely not a deal breaker. 

Overall, this place was exactly what we needed. No fuss, affordable, and delicious. SF has an outstanding food scene, but there are not enough places in the City like Eat Americana.  We will definitely be back!
author: Kaylen K.

description:
I have been coming to Americana for more than 10 years. As some of the other reviewers had mentioned, it has gone under renovation. I've been through the last renovation and changes, and I wish I could say I loved this renovation but I have to say it's simply average.

I used to love the flavoring that the food used to have and the neighborhood feel that it brought. I am not impressed with the new direction that this has taken. I used to love the burgers here and now they are simply ok. Add this with the fact that the price change and less food, then I'm just paying more for less/mediocre food.

I guess they have a new chef that has taken over the menu and kitchen who is supposed to be great? I don't mind price changes when I'm supporting a neighborhood restaurant, but I have to say that I have most likely eaten here for the last time.
author: Rachel K.

description:
Excellent and delicious food!!!!!
I went yesterday with my boyfriend and we had a beet salad, and polenta with shrimp!!!! The salad was delicious!!  fresh with little nuts and cheese  top quality ingredients!!! and perfect full of flavor!!
My boyfriend had the dish with polenta and shrimp i donot remember the name of that  dish but trust me  you have to eat that !!!! the polenta was tasty soft (it melts in your mouth) and the shrimp was freshhh!!!!  well condimented to perfection.
Thanks Eat Americana for that delicious feast.
author: Cecilia C.

description: I like this place the idea of this place, I want it to succeed. My friend had a nice three egg omelette. I had the crab cake with egg and avocado salsa side, sounds good but the crab cake was over fried and for some reason tasted like liver. Guessing off day, but I would only go back for the burger which looked delicious.
author: Susan K.

description: Love the new chef and staff! This is a great staple in the outer Richmond. Trivia night host is hilarious
author: Elizabeth S.

description: I really enjoyed my burger and the ambience. Small place, quiet, friendly staff, and good food. FYI it has a meat heavy menu, but you can easily check this before coming(which I did not do) and pick a different spot if you are looking for salads or some veggies. Great burger though! Will be sure to return!!
author: Molly B.

description: good gravy!!! Seriously, GREAT gravy. And awesome service. Highly recommend this spot.
author: Chad O.

description: Great for locals, not worth seeking out for visitors. So the food was good and if we lived in the area would definitely visit again I'm sure. The service was very nice but a little slow, ambiance is nothing memorable, but the food was good. I don't think it's something worth seeking out if you're like us, visiting a city, using Yelp to find great local spots. But if you live nearby, definitely give it a try.
author: k l.

description:
Been coming here for over 20 years, looking forward to the ABC burger, breakfast for the kids and pasta for the wife. It's sad to see this wonderful restaurant transformed into something it's not. This isn't the Americana from before. I want the old Americana back. 

The burger was just OK. I wasn't too happy with the new bun. I don't mind paying 10 bucks for the burger and 3 dollars more for the basket of fries, but I miss the old burger. It had a more beefy flavor than the new patty.

I wanted to love this place, and cheer on the old owner, but I'm not sure if I'll ever be back. I just may have to go down the block back to where it all started at Little Henry's.
author: diewney n.

description: The bacon was soggy and not crispy. Toast does not come with the breakfast and when you ask for it they don't bring you jelly or butter. The poor mans steak frites was bland and you needed a lot of salt.while waiting for a table the staff don't follow the waitlist and would sit other parties ahead of other people. Over all bland food that is priced accordingly and poor service. There are better options in the neighborhood
author: Jeremiah S.

description: Happy St. Patrick's Day.  Today's Special - Corned Beef Sandwich on butter-grilled Rye bread with sauerkraut $13 is thick-cut meltingly tender brisket - absolutely delicious!  I loved every bite.  Today only.
author: Geri S.

description: The menu has been totally transformed with a new chef in place, and in all the right ways. Absolutely recommend their waffle fries-- one of the best appetizers I've ever tasted.
author: Pierre T.

description: First time back since the remodel. Still was not sure what was going on as the head chef seemed a little out of place compared to how it used to be. Inside is definitely nicer looking. Food seems mostly the same with some fancier dishes and a piece hike across the board. Definitely bummed to see the increase in price but it's SF and prices only skyrocket here.
author: Andrew K.

description: This place is unique and yummy. Staff is nice and the food is delicious.  I love the mix between Asian  And American culture.  San Francisco rocks.
author: Molly G.

description:
I'd give them 2.5 stars, being generous because the servers were nice, and because maybe we didn't order the right things?? 
Went there with the family, and we had 2 little kids with us. The restaurant was almost full, with most patrons just sitting around and waiting for their food, while the kitchen kept turning out to-go/delivery orders. We ended up waiting almost an hour for our food, and then it all was brought to the table at once, although I asked several times that we have whatever comes out first brought first, so the kids could at least nibble on something. By the time the food finally arrived, the kids were totally starving, and they devoured the grilled cheese sandwich, but at that point I expect they would have eaten anything at all. So I didn't get to taste the sandwich, but it did not look like the best grilled cheese I've ever had. No one wanted to eat the soup that came with it, and tasted like a canned tomato soup. We also had the pulled pork sandwich, which was okay, but also far from the best pulled pork, and I had the goat cheese cakes, which were greasy and tasteless, with very little goat cheese and vegetables that looked much better than they tasted. 
So the food was edible, although not very good, and the wait unacceptable IMO. Like I said, the servers were nice. Would only go there again if there were literally no other options in the area, which is unlikely given the concentration of restaurants there.
author: Sushi M.

description: I live close by and come here regularly. The owner and the chef are super nice and always welcoming. The food is so delicious I always have a hard time choosing what to order. I ALWAYS get an order of their biscuits with honey butter.. they are to die for. Some of my favorites are the French toast (made with super rich and decadent bread pudding), the BAT scramble, the pulled pork waffle fries, the burger and Philly cheesesteak are excellent, basically everything I've ordered was delicious! They add to the menu every once and awhile and I can't wait to try anything they come up with. Must try!
author: Simone D.

description:
Been a regular for over 20 years. After model boat events, we swing by here for a nice lunch back. Hamburger,Vietnamese plate, especially French toast and bacon. 
I passed by to eat after being closed for a while and I see a complete change!! No more traditional breakfast....? Price up too. 

I guess the owner wants a change and decided to compete with cassava. 

Front renovation with modern designs and bright neon lights with heater outside will attract young crowds. 
Simple pleasure has it upfront too. 

Cassava did a lot to catch on public's attention infront of the restaurant. 

Good suggestion to the new owner.
author: Julio M.

description: Ate here even before it remodeled. I like the old place but I love the new place. A great new old addition to the area.
author: Cm Tú Đ.

description: Overall it was very worth it, the food is inexpensive for what you get which is really good American comfort food.
author: Joe C.

description: So sad that they've changed their menu..  Their chicken pramagiana is nothing like what I've had since I've been coming here as a kid.. Now it tastes like cheesecake factory style foods. Pretty much typical food you find everywhere else. Very sad to see the culture of the restaurant has changed.
author: Steph L.

description: Great breakfast here today since we were in SF to run an errand. Friendly staff, excellent service and wonderful food. We'll be back.
author: Dana J.

description:
I came here for the first time with my son & his friends. The food was excellent. We ordered almost everything on the menu and everything was spot on!
Love the polenta, beet & goat cheese salad and the bacon & meat burger was to die for!
Will have to come back to try the breakfast or lunch menu!
Great service & food- a gem in the Richmond area!
author: Albert Y.

description: Got some food to take home. Fresh and delicious. Next time I'm headed in for breakfast.
author: Ann R.

description: Great food. Exactly what the neighborhood needed. Delicious, great quality and not overpriced.
author: Erin M.

description: We are thrilled to have one of our favorite chefs back at an awesome location in the Richmond. The bread pudding French toast with fresh strawberries and homemade whip cream was to die for. We had the famous beef and bacon burger, with the bacon grinded into the burger patty. It tasted as juicy as ever. I'm looking forward to coming back to enjoy their dinner menu. Many favorites from Ricky Bobby are also on the menu including new twists. I will be enjoying many meals here in the future. The owner and staff were also very attentive, friendly and accommodating.
author: Brittny R.

description: Hey hey hey here is the Best burger in San Francisco with the friendliest staff! So many options on the wonderful menu. Love this place :-) ~*~*~*~
author: Auston M.

description:
Took the family here for breakfast.  After being seated, they pretty much forgot about us; no tableware, napkins, water, anything.  15 minutes later, a waiter comes and asks us if we're ready to order.  I hate it when they ask that after making us wait a long time!  I mentioned that after the long wait, yes, we're ready to order.  The waiter looks at me like "you have your nerve to complain!".  I didn't take it further, as I didn't want him spitting in my food!

I ordered decaf coffee with my meal, as I greatly reduced my caffeine intake.  He brought out a cup of hot water and a packet of decaf instant coffee.  I told him to just give me regular coffee instead and he insisted that I try the decaf.  After a couple of sips, I had him bring me the regular coffee.

Eventually, our food was brought out, but one order at a time with long pauses between each order.  My wife's order was last, and my son was almost finished with his before it came out.  For the price of each plate, I was a bit surprised that toast didn't come with the meal.  Also, serving sizes were pretty small for the price.  My son had the bread pudding French toast, and 4 small squares, each about a mouthful, came out with a lot of whipped cream.  We had 4 different dishes, and they were all okay, but not worth coming for.

I know some people love this place, but we won't be coming back.  Oh well, different strokes for different folks.
author: W J.

description: Great breakfast/brunch spot. I had the B.A.T. scramble with hash browns and pancake on the side. Very good food and friendly service.
author: R S.

description: Went there this past Saturday bc I heard my all time fave restaurant, Americana had a complete make-over.  Though I will miss the old menu tremendously, the new items are pretty awesome.  Hands down, my fave were the bread pudding French toast and eggplant lasagna.  Homemade, all from scratch.  Seriously, the bread pudding was probably the best I've had.  The shrimp polenta and burger were pretty darn good too.  I'd recommend going with a few friends and trying everything family style so you can get a better taste of the new menu.  The best part is that Americana still kept everything on their menu under $20.  High quality food for a decent price.  It doesn't get any better than that.
author: Lusa L.

description: Again, another great dining place with the sweetest owner. He recognized my friend who hadn't been there in years and offered us a sample of Their pulled pork waffle fries which was delicious from start to finish. We then ordered a simple caprese salad where normally they deep fry their mozzarella..but they kept it simple for us. I then got their country biscuit breakfast with 2 eggs and gravy. Would reccomend for brunch and lunch. Cute dining experience! :)
author: Nerrissa M.

description: I was a bit skeptical when they changed the menu, most of my favorite dishes were no longer available. I since have been back 3 times and I must admit that I was wrong. even though their selection is much smaller now, the quality and taste of the food is amazing. Definitely will go back and sample the rest of their menu.
author: William T.

description:
If you have not been here in awhile, give it another shot.  I visited this spot when it was called Cafe Americana.  They have recently updated their menu and redecorated the restaurant.  

I love it!  This is no longer a place we go to because there is nothing else in the area.  This is now a place that we choose to go to because we like it.

My husband loves the pecan pancakes.  Their buttermilk biscuits are to die for.  We're both picky eaters and I have enjoyed everything I've tried since the re-do.
author: Robyn P.

description: I would return here in a heartbeat!  The food is excellent, the staff are so nice and friendly and the prices are fair. It may not have the ambience of some "cooler" places but it is so good.
author: J. S.

description: Delicious southern inspired comfort food expertly executed. Shrimp Diavolo and steak fried rice are delicious. With Vietnamese drip coffee? Why not?
author: chuck l.

description: We ate here years ago and it was horrible. I learned that there was new ownership or a new chef, so I tried it again today. The service was sssssllllllllooooooowwwwww. It took forever just to get menus, then water, then to order, then to get our food. The food was OK. Nothing to gush about, but not bad. I got a breakfast burrito, and for $12 I expected a salad or some fruit or something else on the plate. But nope. It was a giant plate with a burrito cut in half on it, making it look very small. My 2-year-old had the grilled cheese with tomato soup, which was what it was. I was going to get a hot chocolate, but at $4, I'm glad I asked if it was real hot chocolate or from a powder packet. He said it was from a packet. This city has gotten out of control with pricing. $30 for a small lunch for 1 adult and 1 toddler is a little ridiculous. The bread pudding french toast sounded good, but not sure how quickly we'll be back, unless we plan ahead and have tons of time.
author: Amy B.

description: The power Tony is very friendly, the food are delicious, we ordered Cioppino, seafood in a rich broth, very tasty, but a little pricey. The Italian sausage with spinach fettuccine in garlic sauce was delicious. The eggplant parmigiana with vegetable rigatoni was good too.
author: Lily L.

description: Great food in a cozy atmosphere. Chicken park, beef and broccoli, grilled cheese and eggs with avocado were all awesome. Service was excellent. Great price too. Only bad thing is we wish we lived in neighborhood so we could dine every week!
author: Michael K.

description: The Pulled Pork Waffles is excellent.  It is a must-ordered Starter.  The Pork Flat Iron Steak is my favorite.
author: Jc L.

description: Best bacon burger in San Francisco IMHO. The sweat pickled garnish on the side, a piece put on the palette after each bite, is a foodie sensation!! The waffle fries, a signature dish, puts Americana well ahead of any West Coast eatery. Will continue going back to delve into the rest of the menu. Thank you for bringing your experience to the Outer Richmond.
author: Stephen L.

description: WOW. We had an incredible breakfast here today!! We are in from out of town and a guy walked by us on the street and pointed us here! Tried many different things on the menu and not a single disappointment at the table:) Pumpkin pancakes, breakfast burritos, burger and sweet potato tots and lots of coffee!
author: Jessica A.

description: This is just a review of the burger. Before the change I used to come her just for the burgers since they were big. This is the 2nd time coming after the change and the patty really shrunk. Feels like eating a kiddie burger in an oversized bun.
author: Benson C.

description: First time visitor. The food is great and reasonably priced. Steak fried rice and Philly steak sandwich is definitely something I would order again although there are other items on the menu I have to try. Oh the pulled pork waffle fries were delectable. Good job guys.
author: Alan D.

description: We recently ate here and really loved the food!  They have a new menu and each dish is made with high quality ingredients.  It tastes really good!  I had the mushroom cheeseburger and the patty was delish!  The place is kid friendly too.  My kids really love the grilled cheese here.  We will definitely come back often.  =)
author: Stephanie W.

description: Great spot in the neighborhood!  Lived right around the corner for a little over a year and had never ventured into this spot until today but it was definitely good! The chef makes great food and the service was good.  Great combination of fare and I will definitely be coming back for their pulled pork waffle fries and bottomless sangria/mimosas!
author: Max K.

description: The Philly cheese steak and the pulled pork fries were delicious. You can tell that the food is quality both in ingredients and in chefmanship. I would defiantly come here again.
author: AL M.

description: Had lunch with a friend today and it was delicious. We shared the beet and goat cheese salad and the portobello and mozzarella sandwich yummy!!! Will recommend this place to friends. Nice change to the regular cuisine of the outer Richmond
author: cynthia k.

description: I had a craving for an Americana burger so I call them up only to discover they've completely  re-done their menu. They still had a burger on the "new" menu though so I decided to give it a try hoping they at least kept that and man was I disappointed. The old Americana burger came on a french roll (it sounds weird I know....but it was actually pretty amazing) and the burger itself had so much flavor. I don't usually order burgers out as they range all over the place, but Americana never missed the mark. Fast forward to new Americana burgers....it came on a regular bun, but the top of the bun was super thick. Added to that they put some kind of sauce on it so that the bottom part of the bun became mush. And the burger meat itself....ugh that thing had no taste. The restaurant got a much needed face lift and looks great, but I wish they would have kept the old burger formula. I can't speak for anything else on the menu, but we won't be back to try it out either.
author: Nina M.

description: Still miss BR and RB, but still good to know I can get pork fries. Awesome every time.
author: Ed K.

description: The change was good! New look. New menu and awesome new chef. Everyone should try! We tried the burger, chicken parm, buffalo wings, pull pork fries. They were all delicious!
author: Priscilla W.
